learning_outcomes.description: Explain the nature and basic concepts of research in the context of the main disciplines; earth sciences, environmental management, environmental science, geography and planning.
Conduct a literature search using relevant library tools to identify the core areas of knowledge and questions requiring research to answer.
Construct a critical review of a published body of research in your discipline area.
Construct a research proposal using a recognised research design methodology from the discipline area that you work within.
Identify techniques available for the collection of biophysical, social, economic and cultural data and justify their use in certain projects.

Translate research objectives or questions into tasks of: data collection, analysis, argument, experiment or project, as is appropriate to your discipline. Develop a plan to undertake the work considering constraints of time, equipment, field conditions and coordination with other researchers or consultants; and present this as a time-line or task-schedule for your project.

Produce a standard format research proposal that clearly distinguishes the research findings from existing knowledge and argues for the significance of the research. Present this clearly to both specialist and non-specialist audiences and readers. The completed research proposal and presentation will guide your research in the following semester(s), through to the presentation of the dissertation.

assessments.task_description:
3MT-style presentations on research projects or topics. This is an in person presentation with recording (for record-keeping).

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to develop a critical review of the literature relevant to their research project.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Participation of contact sessions and communication on your research proposal
assessments.task_description:
Students will have the opportunity to conduct in-depth discussions with course staff. Students are required to participate in a few contact sessions during the semester. Contact sessions will include mini lectures and discussions. Students are also required to communicate their research proposal with their peers and the course staff during these contact sessions.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Participation will be recorded during the semester.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(23 Feb - 31 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Contact sessions

This course provides much flexibility for student participation. Students and course staff will schedule to meet a few times during the semester. Please refer to your timetable and Blackboard information.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
